item.title: Issue #1618 created
item.description:
Adaptive serialization: doubles

We should make the serialization spec more liberal when it comes to the representation of double values. The prescribed output format is format-number(?, '0.0##########################e0'), which is very strict and often confusing when maps and arrays are serialized. Maps resulting from JSON conversions often contain doubles without users noticing it (related: #1583).

We should make the behavior implementation-dependent or align it with the serialization of JSON data (without losing its additional features to e.g. serialize function items or sequences). Backward compliance shouldnâ€™t be an important issue, as the method was mainly introduced for debugging purposes.
